title: 10 Books to Read: The Best Reviews of July
sub_head: ‘An American Marriage,’ ‘The Ambassador,’ ‘The Letters of Shirley Jackson’ and more of the books our reviewers highlighted this month.
body:
A selection of the month’s most noteworthy books, as discussed by The Wall Street Journal’s reviewers.
By Earl Swift | Custom House
After landing on the moon, what next? Earl Swift’s account of the final three Apollo missions tracks the singular story of the lunar rover, which let American astronauts not only walk on the moon’s surface but drive on it. Michael O’Donnell finds a tale that turns on how NASA engineers made it happen, including false starts. “Such are Mr. Swift’s narrative talents and the bounties of the source material that the book is a joy to read from beginning to end.”
